text: Israel Is Punished
Israel \add is\add* a luxuriant vine;\f + \fr 10:1 \ft Or “ravaged vine” \f*
he yields fruit for himself.
The more his fruit increased,
\add the more\add* he made numerous altars.
The more his land prospered,
\add the more\add* he\f + \fr 10:1 \ft Hebrew “they” \f* improved\f + \fr 10:1 \ft Or “made beautiful” \f* \add his\add* stone pillars.
Their heart is false;
now they must bear \add their\add* guilt.
He himself\f + \fr 10:2 \ft That is, “Yahweh himself” \f* will break down their altars;
he will destroy their stone pillars.
For now they will say,
“We have no king;
indeed, we did not fear Yahweh,
and what can a king do for us?”
They utter words of vain oaths
\add when\add* ⸤making covenants⸥,\f + \fr 10:4 \ft Literally “cutting covenant” \f*
and judgment blossoms like a poisonous plant
on the furrows of the field.
The inhabitants\f + \fr 10:5 \ft Hebrew “inhabitant” \f* of Samaria tremble
for the calf\f + \fr 10:5 \ft Hebrew “calves” \f* of Beth-aven.
Indeed, his people will mourn for it,
and his idolatrous priests will wail\f + \fr 10:5 \ft Or “rejoice” \f* over it—
over its glory because it has departed from it.
It will also be brought to Assyria,
\add as\add* tribute to \add the\add* great king.\f + \fr 10:6 \ft See 5:13; some translate literally “King Jareb” \f*
Ephraim will obtain disgrace
and Israel will be ashamed from his advice.\f + \fr 10:6 \ft Or “counsel” \f*
Samaria will be destroyed;
her king \add is\add* like a chip on the surface of the water.
The high places of Aven,
the sin of Israel, will be destroyed.
Thorn and thistle will grow
on their altars.
They will say to the mountains, “Cover us,”
and to the hills, “Fall on us.”
From the days of Gibeah you have sinned, \add O\add* Israel;
there ⸤they have remained⸥.\f + \fr 10:9 \ft Literally “they stood” \f*
Will not war in Gibeah overtake them
against the children of evil?
In my desire\f + \fr 10:10 \ft The LXX translates “I will come” \f* I will punish them;
nations will be gathered against them
when they are punished for ⸤their double iniquities⸥.\f + \fr 10:10 \ft So \fqa Qere \ft ; Masoretic Hebrew text (\fqa Kethib \ft ) “their two eyes” \f*
Ephraim \add was\add* a trained heifer,
that loved to thresh \add grain\add*,
and I myself ⸤spared⸥\f + \fr 10:11 \ft Literally “passed over” \f*
the fairness of her neck;
I will make Ephraim break the ground,
Judah will plow,
Jacob must till for himself.
Sow for yourselves righteousness;
⸤reap loyal love⸥.\f + \fr 10:12 \ft Literally “reap according to loyal love” \f*
Break up for yourself fallow ground;
\add it is\add* time to seek Yahweh
so he will come and rain
righteousness upon you.
You have plowed wickedness,
you have reaped injustice,
you have eaten the fruit of lies,\f + \fr 10:13 \ft Hebrew “lie” \f*
because you have trusted in your strength,
in the multitude of your warriors.
The tumult of war will rise up against your people,
and all your fortresses will be destroyed,
as Shalman destroyed Beth-arbel;
on the day of war
mothers were dashed to pieces with \add their\add* children.\f + \fr 10:14 \ft Or “upon \fq their \ft children” \f*
So it will be done to you, \add O\add* Bethel,
because of the evil of your wickedness;
at dawn, the king of Israel
will be utterly destroyed.
